verses.text: Hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ye ear, O house of the king; for judgment \add is\add* towards you, because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.
And the revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I \add have been\add* a rebuker of them all.
I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou art guilty of lewdness, \add and\add* Israel is defiled.
They will not frame their doings to turn to their God: for the spirit of lewdness \add is\add* in the midst of them, and they have not known the LORD.
And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also shall fall with them.
They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the LORD; but they shall not find \add him\add* ; he hath withdrawn himself from them.
They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now shall a month devour them with their portions.
Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, \add and\add* the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud \add at\add* Beth-aven, after thee, O Benjamin.
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.
The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: \add therefore\add* I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
Ephraim \add is\add* oppressed \add and\add* broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after the commandment.
Therefore \add will\add* I \add be\add* to Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah \add saw\add* his wound, then Ephraim went to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet he could not heal you, nor cure you of your wound.
For I \add will be\add* to Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, \add even\add* I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue \add him\add* .
I will go \add and\add* return to my place, till they acknowledge their offense, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.
